abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Third Technical
            Assistance (Pancheswar) Project for Nepal was
            unsatisfactory. The project achieved most of its objectives,
            its impact on institutional development was negligible,
            sustainability is uncertain at this time, and the
            performance of both the Bank and Borrower was satisfactory.
            Two main lessons can be learned from this project. First, to
            assure optimum utilization of the results of the TA
            (Technical Assistance) measures of the project, further TA
            (in the form of management consultants to implement the
            results) should be considered in the follow-up projects.
            Second, in the future, IDA should ensure that TOR (Terms of
            Reference) for such a substantial institution building
            effort are not beyond what the borrower and implementing
            agency can accept. IDA should ensure the borrower and
            implementing agency ownership of the proposed TA measure.
